page.title: 06Canal-Transport
page.content: The water for the canal comes from Chainbridge in Llangollen out of the River Dee and the canal is filled through a meter house.So that the water will not drain away the people that made the canal put puddled clay on the bottom.The British Waterways first maintained the canal.There was a burst near by about ten years ago and the water from the canal covered lots of the farmers fields.The {Shropshire {Union canal}runs from Llangollen to Hurlston.The craft that use the canal are Narrow Boats.Coal and lime used to be brought along the canal,and the lime was burnt in the lime kilns in Welshampton and was also used as fertilizer on the nearby farms.The people of Ellesmere and Salop thought that building the canal would be a quick and sure way of making money.
